# padded(_:)

**Type Method**

Returns a custom format style that portrays the year of the calendar system of the provided length, zero-padded if necessary.

## Declaration

```swift
static func padded(_ length: Int) -> Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Year
```

## Parameters

- **length**: The length of the string to display a calendar year.

## Return Value

A custom year format style that portrays the year of the calendar system with the provided length.

## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year/padded(_:)] to display a year using three or more digits, zero-padded if necessary. For example, `002`, `020`, `201`, `2017`.

## Modifying a Year

- **defaultDigits**: The custom year format style showing the minimum number of digits that represents the numeric year.
- **twoDigits**: The custom format style portraying the two-digit numeric year, zero-padded if necessary.
- **relatedGregorian(minimumLength:)**: Returns a custom format style that portrays the year of a non-Gregorian calendar system in the corresponding Gregorian year.
- **extended(minimumLength:)**: Returns a custom format style that portrays the year of the calendar system, encompassing all supra-year fields.
